com.avaya.cmapi.evt

Class ServerConnectionDownEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avaya.cmapi.evt.ServerConnectionDownEvent

  • public class ServerConnectionDownEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    Indicates that the socket to the AE server has gone down for some reason.

    The recovery action to take for this event is to call reconnect on the application's ServiceProvider instance. This method will attempt to open a new socket to the AE server, and to reestablish the existing session with a new socket.

    If successful, the application will be able to resume operations without reestablishing its state. The operation may fail if the network is down, or if the session has been terminated on the AE server because the cleanup timer expired. If a SessionCleanedUp exception is received on the call to reconnect, it should be processed as a ServerSessionTerminated event would be. If any other exception is received, the application should set a timer and try to reconnect again at some later time.

    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DISCONNECT_APP_INITIATED
      Indicates that this event is as a result of the application calling ServiceProvider.disconnect().
      static int FAR_END_SOCKET_CLOSURE
      Indicates that the far end closed the socket, or that there was some other I/O exception when using the socket.
      static int RESPONSE_TIMEOUT
      Indicates that a timeout occurred when waiting for the response to a request and that the socket was closed as a result.

      • ServerConnectionDownEvent

        public ServerConnectionDownEvent(int code,
                                 java.lang.String reason,
                                 java.lang.Throwable e)
        Construct a ServerConnectionDownEvent with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        code - Indicates the reason for the event. Set to one of the constants defined in this class.
        reason - Text indication of the reason for the disconnection.
        e - The Exception that caused this event, or a Throwable containing the stack trace to where the event originated.
